observation: I can see the Specter.AI homepage with a Sign Up button in the header and Create Account/Get Started buttons below. There are also form elements visible including email and password input fields, along with a Next button. As an elderly user, I need to find the sign-up form to complete registration. The email and password fields are visible but quite far down the page.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user with limited tech experience, I need to start filling out the sign-up form. I can see email and password input fields on the page. I should start by entering my email address in the email field to begin the registration process. The email field appears to be ready for input.
ux_issues: Form fields appear very far down the page requiring scrolling
Small input fields may be difficult for elderly users to tap accurately
